# What is quarto?

## 

An open-source scientific and technical publishing system

Create dynamic content with Python, R, Julia, and Observable.

Publish reproducible, production quality articles, presentations,
dashboards, websites, blogs, and books in HTML, PDF, MS Word, ePub, and
more.

Include auto-numbered and cross-referencable equations, figures and
tables

Integrate with Zotero

## Uses Markdown

Markdown is a plain text format that is designed to be easy to write,
and, even more importantly, easy to read:

# Markdown foundations

## Text Formatting

+------------------------------+------------------------------+
| Markdown Syntax              | Output                       |
+==============================+==============================+
| ``` markdown                 | *italics*, **bold**, ***bold |
| *italics*,                   | italics***                   |
| **bold**, ***bold italics*** |                              |
| ```                          |                              |
+------------------------------+------------------------------+
| ``` markdown                 | superscript^2^ /             |
| s                            | subscript~2~                 |
| uperscript^2^ / subscript~2~ |                              |
| ```                          |                              |
+------------------------------+------------------------------+
| ``` markdown                 | ~~strikethrough~~            |
| ~~strikethrough~~            |                              |
| ```                          |                              |
+------------------------------+------------------------------+
| ``` markdown                 | `verbatim code`              |
| `verbatim code`              |                              |
| ```                          |                              |
+------------------------------+------------------------------+

| #### Header 4  |                              |
| ```            | #                            |
|                |                              |
|                | #                            |
|                | # Header 4 {.heading-output} |
+----------------+------------------------------+

## Lists

+------------------------------+----------------------------+
| Markdown Syntax              | Output                     |
+==============================+============================+
| ``` markdown                 | -   unordered list         |
| * unordered list             |     -   sub-item 1         |
|     + sub-item 1             |     -   sub-item 2         |
|     + sub-item 2             |         -   sub-sub-item 1 |
|         - sub-sub-item 1     |                            |
| ```                          |                            |
+------------------------------+----------------------------+

## Lists

+------------------------------+----------------------------+
| Markdown Syntax              | Output                     |
+==============================+============================+
| ``` markdown                 | 1.  ordered list           |
| 1. ordered list              | 2.  item 2                 |
| 2. item 2                    |     i)  sub-item 1         |
|     i) sub-item 1            |         A.  sub-sub-item 1 |
|          A.  sub-sub-item 1  |                            |
| ```                          |                            |
+------------------------------+----------------------------+

## Equations

Use `$` delimiters for inline math and `$$` delimiters for display math.
For example:

+-----------------------+-----------------------+
| Markdown Syntax       | Output                |
+=======================+=======================+
| ``` markdown          | inline math:          |
| inli                  | $E=mc^{2}$            |
| ne math: $E = mc^{2}$ |                       |
| ```                   |                       |
+-----------------------+-----------------------+
| ``` markdown          | display math:         |
| display math:         |                       |
|                       | $$E = mc^{2}$$        |
| $$E = mc^{2}$$        |                       |
| ```                   |                       |
+-----------------------+-----------------------+
